digest_items.title: Use parameterized queries
digest_items.why: Parameterized queries prevent SQL injection attacks
digest_items.fix: Never concatenate user input into SQL; use prepared statements instead

digest_items.title: Verify backup encryption
digest_items.why: Unencrypted backups are a major data breach risk if storage is compromised
digest_items.fix: Enable encryption at rest and in transit for all backup solutions

digest_items.title: Use secure random number generation
digest_items.fix: Use crypto.randomBytes() or secrets module, not Math.random()

digest_items.title: Implement DMARC policy
digest_items.why: DMARC builds on SPF and DKIM to give domain owners control over email authentication

digest_items.title: Scan for exposed secrets in repos
digest_items.why: Committed secrets can be found by attackers scanning public repositories
digest_items.fix: Use tools like git-secrets or truffleHog to scan commit history

digest_items.title: Use environment variables for secrets
digest_items.why: Hardcoded secrets in code are exposed in version control
digest_items.fix: Store secrets in .env files (gitignored) or secret management services

digest_items.title: Use principle of least privilege
digest_items.why: Excessive permissions increase blast radius of compromised accounts
digest_items.fix: Grant only minimum necessary permissions for each role

digest_items.title: Use HSTS headers
digest_items.why: HTTP Strict Transport Security forces browsers to only connect via HTTPS
